column5: There is a musky show going on in this area this weekend. So i took a little road trip with the wife. I picked me up a few goodies. But i think i spent my entire fishing allowance for several years, and my wife almost killed me when she found out how much i spent. She was ok with it after i explained to her why i needed another rod and reel. Anways, I picked a St Croix 7.6 M/H rod and Shimano Calcutta 400. Also a few spinner baits,bucktails, a jointed believer and a top raider.
Nice haul Matt. You can't go wrong with any of those purchases...it's all quality stuff.
Nice stuff - I just tell the wife that I amoritize it over 20 years....sounds like a good investment then,

I figured i would pick some of the bare essentials and i also explained to my wife that this stuff last for a lifetime. I told her how my other nice reels have lasted for well over 15 years, while the crappy stuff lasts a year or two and falls apart. She thought that was a good excuse.  But i think i will be working it off at home doing dishes, cooking food, etc.
Not to mention the 'other stuff' you'll have to do. :-)
Good stuff Matt!  Please tell me you didn't go to Columbus, I was headed there last evening and had a change of plans made for me.  Whopper
Very nice purchase, good luck with those dishes.
i went to the columbus muskie show. They had some cool stuff there. This was my first time to an all muskie show and i really enjoyed it.
Very nice combo, how many pairs of shoes does she own? that should stop any discussions in their tracks.
I've tried to use that argument before and I always loose.
When I die I just hope that my wife doesn't sell my Muskie stuff for what I "SAID" I paid for it!!!!
You made a good choice on the Premier / Calcutta combo Matt. They  work well together and you'll get alot of years of good service from them.  Some nice baits there too.
I'll give you $5 for that jointed Believer right now Mat!
